definitions.definition: publicly acknowledge someone as a participant in the production of (something published or broadcast).
examples: the screenplay is credited to one American and two Japanese writers
synonyms: put down "the scheme's success can be credited to the team's frugality"

definitions.definition: ascribe (an achievement or good quality) to someone.
examples: he is credited with painting one hundred and twenty-five canvases

definitions.definition: add (an amount of money) to an account.
examples: this deferred tax can be credited to the profit and loss account
you would hardly credit it—but it was true
synonyms: take something as gospel (truth) "the wise will seldom credit all they hear"
